summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2021 between a FedEx Senior Paralegal, Tracy Chapell, and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York. The prosecutors are seeking a records custodian to authenticate and potentially testify about FedEx shipment records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically from a 2008 subpoena. The emails discuss locating records and preparing for Maxwell's upcoming trial.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal, Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx employee corresponding with federal prosecutors to locate shipment records and arrange for a records custodian to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial for which prosecutors are seeking FedEx records. Mentioned as the person whose trial is scheduled to start in November.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject of the prosecutors' search for FedEx account data and shipment records.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact who handled a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

connections.description: Both are named together as the subjects of the prosecutors' search for FedEx account and shipment data.
Chapell is assisting prosecutors in obtaining records that may be used as evidence in Maxwell's criminal trial.
Chapell is assisting prosecutors in obtaining FedEx records associated with Epstein's account.

events.title: Subpoena to FedEx from SD Florida
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

locations: Memphis, TN 38125 (FedEx Legal Department, 3620 Hack Cross Road Building B, 3rd Floor)
New York, New York 10007 (Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza)
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY were actively seeking FedEx shipment records from 2007-2020 associated with Jeffrey Epstein (account number 1144-2081-6) and Ghislaine Maxwell in preparation for Maxwell's November 2021 trial.
A previous subpoena for FedEx records was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008, indicating earlier investigative interest.
FedEx's IT system could not retrieve data from before 2007, limiting the historical scope of the record search.
The correspondence shows the procedural steps taken to authenticate potential evidence, including identifying a records custodian to sign an affidavit and potentially testify at trial.
